page.title: 08Bexhill-History of Tourism 1
page.content: Although Bexhill lies on the sunny south coast, it is more thought of as a retirement haven for over 65's and not as a prospering holiday{resort.} There is poor entertainment but a refreshment to the weary traveller is the{De La Warr Pavilion}on the seafront. There are not many{amusement {arcades}to accomodate the young video enthusiast and this confirms the idea of Bexhill being a haven for the old. The{hotel industry}has almost completely died in Bexhill. Once upon a time, many big and grand hotels lined the Victorian seafront and grand people came on their little sojourns for the quietness and simple scenery of Bexhill. In the 1950's it started and boomed as a resort. This was before the advent of jet airliners. People wanted quiet holidays with {deckchairs, candyfloss and rock.}
